Question_1.Context: Researchers have been studying organic and inorganic composite perovskites as next-generation solar cells for more than a decade. Substantial contributions from researchers with various backgrounds have resulted in the rapid development of perovskite solar cells (PSCs).
Question_1.Question: What is the primary focus of research in the first period of Sn–Pb mixed perovskites?
Question_1.B: Optimizing the electron and hole transport layers
Question_1.C: Preventing the oxidation of Sn2+ ions
Question_1.D: Confirming the possibility of replacing Pb with Sn at the B site of the perovskite structure
Question_1.Source: In the first period, researchers focused on confirming the possibility of replacing Pb with Sn at the B site of the perovskite structure.

Question_2.Context: Efforts were made to improve the quality, morphology, and thickness of Sn–Pb mixed perovskite polycrystalline thin films to overcome their inferior light absorption coefficient.
Question_2.Question: What was the main objective during the second period of research on Sn–Pb mixed perovskites?
Question_2.A: Enhancing the stability of the perovskite films
Question_2.D: Increasing the bandgap of the perovskite materials
Question_2.Source: Efforts were made to improve the quality, morphology, and thickness of Sn–Pb mixed perovskite polycrystalline thin films to overcome their inferior light absorption coefficient.

Question_3.Context: Researchers focused on preventing the oxidation of Sn2+ ions, which led to significant improvements in efficiency.
Question_3.Question: What was the primary goal during the third period of research on Sn–Pb mixed perovskites?
Question_3.A: Enhancing the surface morphology of the perovskite films
Question_3.C: Preventing the oxidation of Sn2+ ions
Question_3.Source: Researchers focused on preventing the oxidation of Sn2+ ions, which led to significant improvements in efficiency.

Question_4.Context: The focus shifted to surface defect control, resulting in further improvements in efficiency and stability.
Question_4.Question: What was the main emphasis during the fourth period of research on Sn–Pb mixed perovskites?
Question_4.A: Enhancing the interfacial properties between the perovskite and carrier transport layers
Question_4.B: Improving the stability of the perovskite materials
Question_4.C: Optimizing the electron and hole transport layers
Question_4.D: Controlling the energy-level change that occurs when Sn is incorporated into the perovskite crystal structure
Question_4.Source: The focus shifted to surface defect control, resulting in further improvements in efficiency and stability.

Question_5.Context: The best reported JSC is 32.5 mA cm−2, whereas the theoretical JSC can reach up to 39.0 mA cm−2.
Question_5.Question: What is a significant challenge that needs to be addressed in Sn–Pb mixed perovskites?
Question_5.A: Optimizing the stability of the perovskite films
Question_5.D: Achieving the theoretical short-circuit current density
Question_5.Source: The best reported JSC is 32.5 mA cm−2, whereas the theoretical JSC can reach up to 39.0 mA cm−2.

Question_6.Context: Efforts have been made to explore ETL and HTL optimization for the bandgap structure of Sn–Pb mixed perovskites.
Question_6.Question: What area of research needs further exploration to improve the performance of Sn–Pb mixed perovskites?
Question_6.A: Optimizing the stability of the perovskite films
Question_6.B: Developing large-scale deposition and modularization processes
Question_6.Source: Efforts have been made to explore ETL and HTL optimization for the bandgap structure of Sn–Pb mixed perovskites.

Question_7.Context: The development of ETLs, HTLs, or interfaces of perovskites that do not exhibit chemical influence needs to be studied more systematically in terms of stability.
Question_7.Question: What aspect of Sn–Pb mixed perovskites needs to be further researched to enhance stability?
Question_7.B: Developing large-scale deposition and modularization processes
Question_7.D: Studying ETLs, HTLs, or interfaces for stability
Question_7.Source: The development of ETLs, HTLs, or interfaces of perovskites that do not exhibit chemical influence needs to be studied more systematically in terms of stability.

Question_8.Context: The efficiency growth shown in a relatively short period of time with relatively little research attention is quite remarkable.
Question_8.Question: What is a notable aspect of the progress in the development of Sn–Pb mixed perovskites?
Question_8.A: The rapid increase in theoretical efficiency
Question_8.B: The achievement of high stability in perovskite films
Question_8.C: The significant efficiency improvements with limited research attention
Question_8.D: The successful replacement of Pb with Sn in perovskite structures
Question_8.Source: The efficiency growth shown in a relatively short period of time with relatively little research attention is quite remarkable.

Question_9.Context: Efforts have been made to systematically conduct research in the direction of existing research and this review to open up new possibilities for perovskite-based materials beyond Pb-based perovskites in the future.
Question_9.Question: What is the ultimate goal of the research on Sn–Pb mixed perovskites?
Question_9.A: To achieve the highest efficiency among all solar cell materials
Question_9.B: To replace all Pb-based perovskites with Sn-based perovskites
Question_9.C: To develop large-scale deposition and modularization processes
Question_9.D: To open up new possibilities for perovskite-based materials beyond Pb-based perovskites
Question_9.Source: Efforts have been made to systematically conduct research in the direction of existing research and this review to open up new possibilities for perovskite-based materials beyond Pb-based perovskites in the future.

Question_10.Context: The efficiency growth shown in a relatively short period of time with relatively little research attention is quite remarkable.
Question_10.Question: What is a significant achievement highlighted in the progress of Sn–Pb mixed perovskites?
Question_10.A: The successful replacement of Pb with Sn in perovskite structures
Question_10.B: The rapid increase in theoretical efficiency
Question_10.C: The significant efficiency improvements with limited research attention
Question_10.D: The achievement of high stability in perovskite films
Question_10.Source: The efficiency growth shown in a relatively short period of time with relatively little research attention is quite remarkable.
